title: Sweet And Spicy Asian Pork Shoulder Recipe
summary: Sweet And Spicy Asian Pork Shoulder Recipe might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 4 and costs $2.3 per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 41g of protein, 13g of fat, and a total of 576 calories. 646 people found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. If you have five-spice powder, chili-garlic sauce, ginger, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the kosher salt you could follow this main course with the Low Fat Crumbs Cake (Kosher-Dairy) as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 13 hours and 10 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and dairy free diet. With a spoonacular score of 99%, this dish is excellent. Try Sweet and Spicy Pork Shoulder with Sesame Cucumbers, Asian Crispy Chicken Wings + Spicy Sweet Chili Sauce Recipe, and Sweet and Spicy Asian Pork Quesadillas for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Asian can be paired with Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. The Union Sacre Belle de Nuit Dry Gewurztraminer with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 18 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Union Sacre Belle de Nuit Dry Gewurztraminer
productMatches.description: Gew√ºrztraminer is difficult to capture, on the vine it will go from pitch-perfect to over-ripe in a number of hours. As wine, it has an amazingly wide breadth of characteristics that it can display, it can be spice-driven, floral, sweet, bone-chillingly dry, clear, orange or pink. When it is done well it is a thing of rare, fleeting beauty that will last decades, much like the memory of a beautiful woman met once and disappeared.
